history.content:
https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

You won't necessarily be harmed by P/NP'ing it, but it won't count towards your degree. ALL courses that count towards some degree must be taken for a letter grade. In other words, if you end up P/NP 'n' units worth of classes, then those 'n' units must be made up with other eligible courses (letter grade).

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

You won't necessarily be harmed by P/NP'ing it, but it won't count towards your degree. ALL courses that count towards some degree must be taken for a letter grade. In other words, if you end up P/NP 'n' units worth of classes, then those 'n' units must be made up with other eligible courses.

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs-upperdiv

You're allowed to P/NP it, but it won't count towards your degree. ALL courses that count towards some degree must be taken for a letter grade. In other words, if you end up P/NP 'n' units worth of classes, then those 'n' units must be made up with other eligible courses.
Student answer. But yes, you can change it. You won't be stopped (would if you were EECS).

I am an L&S CS student, not in my final semester. Can I P/NP (by the P/NP deadline) an EE or CS upper div course that can count towards meeting major credit requirements ? If I do so, I would take other upper div courses in subsequent semester to meet the required amount of credits for majoring. But my question is, am I allowed to P/NP "can-count-towards-major technical courses" if I want to ?
history.subject: Can I P/NP a technical course that can count as major requirement ?

history.content: I am an L&S CS student, not in my final semester. Can I P/NP (by the P/NP deadline) an EE or CS upper div course that can count towards meeting major credit requirements ? If I do so, I would take other upper div courses in subsequent semester to meet the required amount of credits for majoring. But my question is, am I allowed to P/NP "can-count-towards-major technical courses" for GPA preservation purpose ?
history.subject: Can I P/NP a technical course that can count as major requirement ?
